Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Dr. Cheryl G. Anthony, Pastor, Judah International Christian Center, 141 Rogers Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11216. 

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Cornegy.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Dr. Cheryl G. Anthony, Pastor, Judah International Christian Center. 


Council Member Cornegy moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of May 14 and May 29, 2014 be adopted as printed by Council Member Levine.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Levine moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of May 14, 2014 and May 29, 2014 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Margery Perlmutter to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment to the New York City Board of Standards and Appeals, Pursuant to Sections 31 and 659 of the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Margery Perlmutter, NYC Board of Standards and Appeals

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Adi Shamir Baron to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment to the Landmarks Preservation Commission, Pursuant to Sections 31 and 3020 of the City Charter.

Items.MatterName: Adi Shamir Baron, Landmarks Preservation Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of John Gustafsson to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment to the Landmarks Preservation Commission, Pursuant to Sections 31 and 3020 of the City Charter.

Items.MatterName: John Gustafsson, Landmarks Preservation Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Jacques Jiha to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment to the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission, Pursuant to Sections 31 and 2301 of the City Charter.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Chin:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 263 Lafayette Street, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board No. 4, Application no.  20145468 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk Cafe, 263 Lafayette Street, Manhattan (20145468 TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Rosenthal:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 50 West 72nd Street, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board No. 4, Application no.  20145615 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk Cafe, 50 West 72nd Street, Manhattan (20145615 TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Johnson:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 753 Washington Street, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board No. 4, Application no.  20145294 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk Cafe, 753 Washington Street, Manhattan (20145294 TCM)

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to regulating publicly accessible collection bins.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Regulating publicly accessible collection bins.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign, A.8859/S.4469A, to amend the Education Law, in relation to hazing, serving alcohol to minors and illegal drug offenses.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: Amend the Education Law, in relation to hazing, serving alcohol to minors and illegal drug offenses. (A.8859/S.4469A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Senate to pass S.5740 and the Governor to sign such legislation into law, which would amend the New York State Correction Law by enhancing training for staff in residential mental health treatment unit programs inside correctional facilities.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Enhancing training for staff in residential mental health treatment unit programs inside correctional facilities. (S.5740)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to enforce Chancellor’s Regulation A-801, which requires that students on school buses wear seat belts until the bus comes to a destination stop.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requires that students on school buses wear seat belts until the bus comes to a destination stop.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Education to calculate salaries of teachers in the New York City public school system based on the Department’s central budget rather than an individual school’s budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: DOE to calculate salaries of teachers in the NYC public school system based on the Department’s central budget rather than an individual school’s budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to arterial roadway towing.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Arterial roadway towing.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to requirements and enforcement of newsrack provisions.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requirements and enforcement of newsrack provisions.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to modular newsracks.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Modular newsracks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring restaurants to disclose when gratuity is included in the total cost of services.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Requiring restaurants to disclose when gratuity is included in the total cost of services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to information required to be posted by owners of residential dwellings during utility outages and other emergencies.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Information required to be posted by owners of residential dwellings during utility outages and other emergencies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring that no videotape, or its contents, produced by an agency be destroyed or otherwise disposed of and that the head of each agency transmit to the municipal reference and research center such material in a timely manner.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Requiring that no videotape, or its contents, produced by an agency be destroyed or otherwise disposed of and that the head of each agency transmit to the municipal reference and research center such material in a timely manner.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to notification of community boards of changes of regulations relating to traffic.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Notification of community boards of changes of regulations relating to traffic.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to providing public notice of production permits.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Providing public notice of production permits.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Senate to pass and President to sign companion legislation to H.R. 863, which would establish a commission to study the creation of a National Women’s History Museum.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MatterName: Creation of a National Women’s History Museum. (H.R. 863)

Items.Title: Resolution supporting a statewide and national ban on nontherapeutic uses of antibiotics in livestock production and calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign the Preventing Antibiotic Resistance Act (S. 1256) and the Preservation of Antibiotics for Medical Treatment Act (H.R. 1150).
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Preventing Antibiotic Resistance Act (S. 1256) and the Preservation of Antibiotics for Medical Treatment Act (H.R. 1150).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to written responses by the board of standards and appeals
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Written explanations by the board of standards and appeals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to a comprehensive cultural plan.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Comprehensive cultural plan.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to mitigation of construction noise within seventy-five feet of a school.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Mitigation of construction noise within seventy-five feet of a school.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Department of Education to bring more mentoring programs into schools to combat bullying and violence, as called for in the Stop School Violence online petition campaign by Anthony Vargas, a local high school student.

Items.MatterName: DOE to bring more mentoring programs into schools to combat bullying and violence, as called for in the Stop School Violence online petition campaign by Anthony Vargas, a local high school student.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing the dangers of climate change to human health and the environment and endorsing the People’s Climate March NYC scheduled to precede the United Nations Summit on Climate Change that will take place on September 23, 2014, in New York City, which is “aimed at catalyzing action by governments, business, finance, industry, and civil society in areas for new commitments and substantial, scalable and replicable contributions to the Summit that will help the world shift toward a low-carbon economy.”
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: People’s Climate March New York City - September 23, 2014

Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 2 Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Members Matteo and Ignizio.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Include comprehensive immigration reform, and issues of importance to African immigrants and the African Diaspora, on the agenda for the 2014 U.S.-Africa Leaders Summit.
